original_text: Image Español The last time you scooped some ice cream for dessert, did you limit yourself to half a cup? If you took more—you’re right in step with most people these days. Likewise with a soft drink:...

qa_pairs.text_input: What is the purpose of the updated Nutrition Facts label?
qa_pairs.output: To bring serving sizes closer to what people actually eat so that the calories and nutrients on the label more closely match what they are consuming.

qa_pairs.text_input: Why did the FDA change the criteria for labeling based on package size?
qa_pairs.output: Because people are more likely to eat or drink the entire container or item in one sitting.

qa_pairs.text_input: Are manufacturers required to provide the calorie and nutrient information per serving for packages that are clearly larger than most people would eat in one sitting?
qa_pairs.output: No, manufacturers are only required in these cases to label these products per serving.
